revised_title: Chemical Reactions of Aldehydes and Acids: Hydrolchlorate of Acrolein and Metacrolein
tldr: The author conducted experiments with aldehydes and acids, specifically acrolein and hydrochloric acid, to study their chemical reactions. They discovered a new compound, hydrolchlorate of acrolein, formed by the direct combination of aldehyde and acid. Additionally, they found a new isomer of acrolein, metacrolein, which has different properties and reactions. These findings expanded the understanding of aldehyde and acid chemistry.
